summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Capital One Bank, dated October 7, 2019, demanding extensive financial records related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal criminal statutes including sex trafficking and coercion. The subpoena includes a rider listing specific records to be produced and a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Authored the cover letter requesting non-disclosure and is referenced as the signatory on the subpoena rider.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Designated as the point of contact for the production of subpoenaed records at the FBI's New York field office.

persons.name: Forensic Accountant
persons.context: Listed as a point of contact for questions regarding the subpoena's records request.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which Capital One Bank is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion), and 371 (conspiracy).
The government explicitly requests Capital One Bank to refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.

The subpoena rider requests extensive financial records, including transaction files, wire transfers, safe deposit records, credit card statements, and online banking information, from account inception to the present.

The document lists locations (Miami Beach, NYC, Thomasville) and includes fields for identifiers (AKA, DOB, SSN, address, phone) for specific individuals/entities, though the actual names are not filled in on the provided text.
Personal appearance before the grand jury is waived if the requested records are produced to the FBI Special Agent by the return date with a completed Declaration of Custodian of Records.
